Posts.Content: Daczahow wrote: Was wondering if anyone that had chosen a Lumpectomy with their original diagnosis. Had opted to have a bilateral Mastectomy later? I had a lumpectomy on my right breast in 2015. Went through chemo and radiation. In 2016 I had a what my Oncologist called a local reoccurrence in the lymphnodes at my right clavicle (aka Supraclavicular lymph nodes) I went through chemo and radiation on my neck. I am set to co for my 3rd biopsy on April 10th this time it is my right breast again !!! My gut reaction in 2015 was to have a Bilateral Mastectomy and be done with it! My breast surgeon convinced me to do the breast conserving surgery! I’m am considering no matter the biopsy results asking about Mastectomy... Has anyone had any experience with this? Do you regret the decision to have the Mastectomy? Did your insurance cover this option? Dx 1/22/2015, IDC, Right, 4cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Surgery 2/12/2015 Lumpectomy: Right; Lymph node removal: Sentinel Chemotherapy 3/30/2015 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxol (paclitaxel) Radiation Therapy 8/5/2015 Whole-breast: Breast, Lymph nodes, Chest wall Surgery 11/2/2015 Prophylactic ovary removal Hormonal Therapy 12/3/2015 Arimidex (anastrozole) Surgery 5/2/2016 Lymph node removal: Right Dx 5/6/2016, IDC, Right, Stage IIIC, Grade 3, ER+/PR-, HER2- Radiation Therapy 5/11/2016 External Chemotherapy 7/5/2016 AC Surgery 6/13/2018 Mastectomy: Left, Right; Prophylactic mastectomy: Left; Reconstruction (left): Tissue expander placement; Reconstruction (right): Tissue expander placement Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Mastectomy after a lumpectomy Daczahow bella2013

Posts.Content: Daczahow wrote: Recently diagnosed as a stage 3C just finished my active treatment for my original diagnosis which was in January 2015. My original breast cancer was ER+ HR- HER2 +. The reoccurrence is now her2- just wondering if anyone else is stage IIIC? And or if anyone has faced AC after having TCH?? Dx 1/22/2015, IDC, Right, 4cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Surgery 2/12/2015 Lumpectomy: Right; Lymph node removal: Sentinel Chemotherapy 3/30/2015 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxol (paclitaxel) Radiation Therapy 8/5/2015 Whole-breast: Breast, Lymph nodes, Chest wall Surgery 11/2/2015 Prophylactic ovary removal Hormonal Therapy 12/3/2015 Arimidex (anastrozole) Surgery 5/2/2016 Lymph node removal: Right Dx 5/6/2016, IDC, Right, Stage IIIC, Grade 3, ER+/PR-, HER2- Radiation Therapy 5/11/2016 External Chemotherapy 7/5/2016 AC Surgery 6/13/2018 Mastectomy: Left, Right; Prophylactic mastectomy: Left; Reconstruction (left): Tissue expander placement; Reconstruction (right): Tissue expander placement Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Aug 19, 2016 07:26AM Daczahow wrote: My MO sent me for an MRI on my left shoulder last week. I have been having intense pain especially at night. The MRI report states that the humerus scapula and clavicle bone show some infiltration that is consistent with metastasis. I went for a pet scan/ct which showed no uptake on or around that area. I am so confused !! My MO has ordered a bone scan just to verify! Has anyone had a negative pet scan yet something shows up on the MRI ? I am waiting for the bone scan to be scheduled. A little bit of history I went through my initial treatment for IDC in April 2015 only to have a reoccurrence in my supraclavicular lymph node's (just at the collarbone) in April 2016. I have since completed AC and I'm preparing for 12 weeks of taxol. Any insight would be great!!!!
Posts.Title: If you are not Stage IV but have questions, you may post here chrissyb Olma61

Posts.Content: Aug 17, 2017 06:11AM Daczahow wrote: I felt the knot above my right clavicle. It was hard but was not painful. I called my MO went for a pet scan and it lit up like crazy. After that they did a biopsy to check the pathology The only difference in the path was the her2 status changed from my original diagnosis of positive to being her2 negative.

Mine increased in size pretty rapidly so just keep an eye on it. When I was originally diagnosed with BC I had an internal mammary node show up on my first pet S

Posts.Content: Aug 30, 2017 12:32AM Daczahow wrote: I have been having some pain under my right rib cage for a few months it seems to of gotten worse I spoke to my MO about it and she sent me for a pet scan. The results came back and something is lighting up in the area of the liver called the (Porta hepatis) right now I am waiting for further tests to be scheduled just wondered if anyone had any experience with this area of the liver? I am really praying it is just an infection

Posts.Content: Aug 17, 2017 03:52AM Daczahow wrote: I have already had a reoccurrence in April of 2016 in the right supraclavicular lymph nodes. At the time I was still going every 3 weeks for my herceptin treatments. So I started over again with a new staging of 3c. In March of this year I noticed twinges of pain under my right rib cage. It comes and goes ...I went to my GP and they did an ultrasound done they were concerned that it was my gallbladder however no evidence of gallstones or any other abnormalities on the ultrasound. In May I noticed that pain was becoming more frequent. Most of the time it feels like a muscle spasm under my rib cage usually very sharp and intense. I've also been having pain and my back under my right shoulder blade. I have A PET scheduled for 24 August. Just wondered if anyone had similar symptoms prior to liver Mets diagnosis? I am optimistic and really hoping that it's just a gallbladder issue even though the ultrasound didn't look abnormal.

But tomorrow is another chance !
